name: Wispr Flow
description: AI dictation product that converts speech into polished text across Mac, Windows, iPhone, and newly launched Android.
why_matters: Launched Android on Feb 23, 2026 and claims 4x typing speed (220 vs 45 wpm), signaling strong cross-platform voice productivity demand.

name: Callio
description: API gateway and marketplace that lets AI agents discover and execute multiple third-party APIs through one endpoint.
why_matters: Listed on Feb 23 Product Hunt and advertises 50+ APIs with one key and sub-2-minute setup, reducing integration overhead for agent builders.

name: Siteline
description: Analytics tool focused on AI-agent and bot traffic, helping teams improve visibility in AI-driven discovery channels.
why_matters: Surfaced on Feb 23 Product Hunt with 512 upvotes and states 30% of web traffic is already bot/agent-driven, matching current SEO shifts.

name: Modelence App Builder
description: AI app builder for shipping production apps with built-in auth, database primitives, and observability defaults.
why_matters: Ranked on Feb 24 Product Hunt with 352 upvotes and positions itself as production-ready by default, not prototype-only tooling.

name: Orchids 1.0
description: AI app builder that supports multi-stack generation and lets users bring existing model subscriptions or API keys.
why_matters: Announced Feb 9 and remained hot on Feb 24 Product Hunt; claims 1M+ users and benchmark lead (76% App Bench), indicating rapid adoption.

name: Figr AI
description: AI-native design workspace that converts prompts and screenshots into editable product UI flows and reusable design systems.
why_matters: Product Hunt weekly leaderboard (week of 2026-02-19) shows 1,044 upvotes, a strong early traction signal for AI-first design workflows.

name: Straion
description: AI-driven outbound and growth assistant focused on automated prospect research, message drafting, and campaign iteration.
why_matters: Ranked on Product Hunt weekly board with 1,040 upvotes, indicating rapid PMF testing velocity versus typical early-stage GTM tools.

name: Toolspend
description: Spend intelligence dashboard for teams adopting many AI tools, with license visibility and renewal-control workflows.
why_matters: Reached 1,039 Product Hunt weekly upvotes, suggesting acute demand to control fragmented AI-tool budgets as seat counts scale.

name: Omnia
description: Unified AI workspace that connects documents, apps, and chat into one searchable interface for faster team decisions.
why_matters: Logged 815 upvotes on the same Product Hunt weekly leaderboard, showing breakout attention in the AI knowledge-work interface category.

name: LocalGPT
description: On-device private assistant for search and chat over local files, optimized for users who need data residency and offline usage.
why_matters: Show HN post recorded 62 points and 35 comments within ~2 days, a concrete community validation signal for private-first AI tools.

name: Koidex
description: Developer security scanner for checking whether packages, extensions, and AI models are safe before install.
why_matters: Product Hunt daily #1 on 2026-02-26 with 406 upvotes and 797 followers; also offered first 200 users two weeks unlimited searches, showing fast early demand.

name: Rover by rtrvr.ai
description: Embeddable DOM-native web agent that can click, fill forms, and complete onboarding flows inside product UIs.
why_matters: Product Hunt 2026-02-26 reached 149 upvotes, and Show HN (about 3 days ago) logged 28 points and 18 comments, indicating cross-community validation.

name: WebMCP
description: Open-source JavaScript interface that exposes web-app functionality as MCP tools for AI agents and assistants.
why_matters: Product Hunt launch this week shows 98 points and day rank #19, while related HN discussion and Chrome early-preview coverage signal rapidly growing MCP-in-browser demand.

name: KiloClaw
description: Hosted OpenClaw service for launching personal AI agents without self-hosting infrastructure or maintenance.
why_matters: GA announcement on 2026-02-24 claims 3,500+ waitlist signups, 500+ model access, and under-60-second deployment, strong signals for managed-agent infrastructure demand.

name: OpenClaw
description: Open-source autonomous AI assistant that runs on user-controlled machines and executes tasks across chat apps and tools.
why_matters: OpenClaw momentum remains high this week with 200k+ GitHub-star references in ecosystem reports and fresh media coverage, marking sustained breakout traction beyond launch day.

name: Stitch by Google
description: Google Labs design tool that turns sketches and prompts into production-ready UI drafts.
why_matters: On Product Hunt 2026-02-24 it reached 561 upvotes and 16 comments, a strong launch signal for AI-assisted UI generation.
